str2: Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To break off. From ek and klao; to exscind.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Unbelief, unfaithfulness, distrust. From apistos; faithlessness, i.e. disbelief, or unfaithfulness.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
